applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several reasons: 1) The document is a pension scheme rules document that outlines the operation and governance of a company pension life cover scheme, not an advertisement by an intermediary. 2) While AIB Life is mentioned as the life office provider, this document serves as the legal framework and rules for operating the pension scheme rather than advertising material. 3) The document clearly identifies AIB Life's role as the registered administrator and life office provider, but this is in the context of scheme administration rather than intermediary advertising. 4) The document's purpose is to define scheme rules, benefits, trustee duties and operational procedures rather than promote or advertise financial services. The regulation specifically pertains to intermediaries advertising their services, which is not the purpose or content of this document.
regulation_title: Intermediaries to specify where tied to single provider
regulation_text: 86. Where an intermediary is tied to a single provider for a particular financial service, the intermediary shall specify this fact in all its advertisements in respect of the intermediary's advertised financial service. 66 [81]
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
